content_scrubbed:
The average wage for an Indian person would be around $8,000 Cdn yearly. So considering the fees here are $30,000 a year, it[.] like four times the normal wage of an Indian person just to pay the [tuition].

OK, Mr. Godwin Scott, but you're not going to go back to India with your Canadian engineering degree just to make $8k/year. You're going to stay in Canada and make $80k+ out of university and pay off your debt in a couple years.

 Graduated in 2015, with a law degree from University of Ottawa. 
Graduated with approximately $150,000 of debt.

Unless you come from a rich family that pays for everything isn't that normal? Again, you're going to have no problem paying it off and by the time you become a partner at your law firm you'll be a millionaire.

 Holds a Bachelor degree in animal biology from University of Guelph.  Currently a second-year medical radiation technology student at Algonquin College.
 Expects to graduate with approximately $50,000 of debt.

OK, maybe you shouldn't have gotten that animal biology degree. I've seen this happen plenty of times. Parents push kids into getting a degree that they don't want or is not viable in this job market, and then go to college to get some real skills.

 Third-year PhD student in law and legal studies at Carleton University.
 Approximately $12,500 in debt.

You serious? That[.] nothing.

 Fourth-year humanities student at Carleton University.
 Approximately $15,000 in debt.

Again, this is nothing.

Seriously, what the hell is the point of this article? Is the bleeding-heart CBC trying to guilt us into paying for foreign students tuition and living expenses or is it just a slow news day?
